meanings.definition: Full of or expressing deep emotion or feeling.
meanings.sent1: Her soulful singing touched the hearts of everyone in the audience.
meanings.sent2: The musician's soulful performance brought tears to my eyes.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave me a soulful look when I opened a can of tuna.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in soulful hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: His eyes were soulful, revealing a depth of emotion beyond words.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or possessing a soul or spirit.
meanings.sent1: The old house had a soulful charm that made it feel alive.
meanings.sent2: The artist's soulful paintings seemed to capture the essence of life.
meanings.sent3: The dog's soulful eyes seemed to understand every word I said.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tree had a soulful presence that commanded respect.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody had a soulful quality that resonated with listeners.
